text: <@U01C87PNTDE> Alright seems kinda hacky to me haha, so there isn't any easier way to do this then? so it seems...

Hi there :wave:
Is there a release of `JinJava` coming soon at all? It would be great to get all the new features that were merged from October to now.
Many thanks in advance!
HubL uses the HEAD of JinJava so always should have the latest features. Which one are you looking at using?

Hi <@U6GNQ7JBU> thanks for your response…so a PR that was merged recently (<https://github.com/HubSpot/jinjava/commit/f0cc594f23cbe2929afebfd9825739ff1920124c>) I’d like to integrate into my project…the latest release of jinjava to maven was `2.5.6` …I’m working around it for now by building `JinJava` as a snapshot and publishing to `mavenLocal` however it would be better if I could integrate to my project via `2.5.7` …hope that makes sense…hence the ask.
Ah right we will need to do a release to access the new version via maven. <@UCJANAW1Y> it has been 6 months since last release, how do you feel about a release?
I was thinking that a release soon would be a good idea
Great folks thx a mill and for the great library too :+1:
I may be able to do one this afternoon
Might take 30 minutes -> 1 hour to show up in maven central though
Hey that’s great thank you have a nice weekend :+1:

without knowing the full extent of what you are trying to do, this is a fairly standard way to interact with server side data that is dependent on user input (without refreshing the page). The only difference here is that we are trying to work around the limitations of HubSpot, and serverless functions are the best bet we have for the time being, and if your portal doesn't have that feature, spinning up another server for like $10/month from godaddy, or even a Heroku server is the only alternative.
